verses.text: So when David was old and full \add of\add* days, he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
And he gathered together all the princes of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
Now the Levites were numbered from the age of thirty years and upward: and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty and eight thousand.
Of which, twenty and four thousand \add were\add* to set forward the work of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*; and six thousand \add were\add* officers and judges:
moreover four thousand \add were\add* porters; and four thousand praised the \sc Lord\sc* with the instruments which I made, \add said David\add*, to praise \add therewith\add*.
And David divided them \add into\add* courses among the sons of Levi, \add namely\add*, Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
Of the Gershonites \add were\add*, Laadan, and Shimei.
The sons of Laadan; the chief \add was\add* Jehiel, and Zetham, and Joel, three.
The sons of Shimei; Shelomith, and Haziel, and Haran, three. These \add were\add* the chief of the fathers of Laadan.
And the sons of Shimei \add were\add*, Jahath, Zina, and Jeush, and Beriah. These four \add were\add* the sons of Shimei.
And Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second: but Jeush and Beriah had not many sons; therefore they were in one reckoning, according to \add their\add* fatherâ€™s house.
The sons of Kohath; Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.

The sons of Amram; Aaron and Moses: and Aaron was separated, that he should sanctify the most holy \add things\add*, he and his sons for ever, to burn incense before the \sc Lord\sc*, to minister unto him, and to bless in his name for ever.
Now \add concerning\add* Moses the man of God, his sons were named of the tribe of Levi.
The sons of Moses \add were\add*, Gershom, and Eliezer.
\add Of\add* the sons of Gershom, Shebuel \add was\add* the chief.
And the sons of Eliezer \add were\add*, Rehabiah the chief. And Eliezer had none other sons; but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
\add Of\add* the sons of Izhar; Shelomith the chief.
\add Of\add* the sons of Hebron; Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
\add Of\add* the sons of Uzziel; Michah the first, and Jesiah the second.
The sons of Merari; Mahli, and Mushi. The sons of Mahli; Eleazar, and Kish.
And Eleazar died, and had no sons, but daughters: and their brethren the sons of Kish took them.
The sons of Mushi; Mahli, and Eder, and Jeremoth, three.

These \add were\add* the sons of Levi after the house of their fathers; \add even\add* the chief of the fathers, as they were counted by number of names by their polls, that did the work for the service of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, from the age of twenty years and upward.
For David said, The \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel hath given rest unto his people, that they may dwell in Jerusalem for ever:
and also unto the Levites; \add they\add* shall no \add more\add* carry the tabernacle, nor any vessels of it for the service thereof.
For by the last words of David, the Levites \add were\add* numbered from twenty years old and above:

because their office \add was\add* to wait on the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, in the courts, and in the chambers, and in the purifying of all holy \add things\add*, and the work of the service of the house of God;

both for the shewbread, and for the fine flour for meat offering, and for the unleavened cakes, and for \add that which is baked in\add* the pan, and for that which is fried, and for all \add manner of\add* measure and size;
and to stand every morning to thank and praise the \sc Lord\sc*, and likewise at even;

and to offer all burnt sacrifices unto the \sc Lord\sc* in the sabbaths, in the new moons, and on the set feasts, by number, according to the order commanded unto them, continually before the \sc Lord\sc*:

and that they should keep the charge of the tabernacle of the congregation, and the charge of the holy \add place\add*, and the charge of the sons of Aaron their brethren, in the service of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*.
